title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink at upper edge (*check this)
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation fo the scheme of -1532, the lower part of the arch at left shows one half of a panel as shown at right. A woman sits in front of it raising her right hand holding indistinct objects. The oblong panel at right shows a sphere standing below a festoon. Two women, shown from the back, are seated beside the shaft of the sphere, the left one is shown. Landscape in ruins. Putti are in wedges of the arch. Two putti support a medallion portrait; they are seated upon the entablature, in front of the coffered vault. The central painting is intended to be ovoidal.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink at upper edge (*check this). Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1534.
